conversation.aPrompt: what
conversation.bResponse:
What is the process for enrolling a child into extracurricular activities or school in Romania?
To enroll a child into extracurricular activities, first, contact the County Schools Inspectorates listed here. Fill out the application for enrolling your child, including any desired psycho-pedagogical assistance and counseling options. Download the application here or get it physically from the corresponding County School Inspectorate. For Ukrainian children learning Romanian, schools will provide suitable resources. Submit the application through email or at the inspectorate's headquarters. Your application will be reviewed within one day, followed by communication about placement. Decide on the class assignment during a joint meeting.
To enroll a child into school, follow the similar steps as above but include the audiences statute on the application. For Ukrainian learners, schools will accommodate their needs. Apply online or at the inspectorate's office. Application review takes place within one day, leading to placement decision during a joint meeting. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education
conversation.cSubject: How to enroll a child in school, kindergarten or extracurricular activities

conversation.aPrompt: What documents do I need to enroll in a study program in Romania?
conversation.bResponse:
If you want to enroll in a study program in Romania, here are some important documents that you may need:
1. Passport
2. Statement on your own responsibility regarding previous studies
3. Certificate or decision of recognition of studies (if applicable)
4. Diplomas allowing access to the study cycle previously enrolled in (after completion of studies) For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education
conversation.cSubject: If you are or have been a student and you want to continue your studies in Romania:

conversation.aPrompt: How can I get equivalence of my foreign diploma for admission into a Romanian university?
conversation.bResponse: If you have completed your studies, you should contact the National Center for Recognition and Equivalence of Diplomas (CNRED) at <www.cnred.ro> to evaluate and recognize your diploma. This will allow you to enroll in another cycle of studies or gain access to the Romanian labor market. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education
conversation.cSubject: If you are or have been a student and you want to continue your studies in Romania:

conversation.aPrompt: Do I need to provide proof of my student status when enrolling at a Romanian university?
conversation.bResponse: Yes, it is important to provide evidence of your student status when registering at a Romanian university. According to the legislation in force, students who lack documentary evidence of their student status can register based on an affidavit stating their prior studies, however, each university may have different procedures for assessing admission or resuming studies. Additionally, upon completion of your studies, you must submit the certificates that granted you entry into the study program in which you were enrolled to the Romanian higher education institution. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education
conversation.cSubject: If you are or have been a student and you want to continue your studies in Romania:

conversation.aPrompt: Can Ukrainian citizens benefit from studying in Romania?
conversation.bResponse: Yes, Ukrainian citizens can benefit from studying in Romania. They can enroll in any study cycle at a Romanian higher education institution, provided they hold the required documents proving their student status or submit a statement on their own responsibility regarding previous studies. Additionally, Ukrainian citizens may contact the CNRED (National Center for Diploma Recognition and Equivalence) to evaluate and recognize their previous studies, making them eligible for enrolling in other study cycles. However, it is essential to provide the Romanian higher education institution with the necessary diplomas upon completion of studies. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education
conversation.cSubject: If you are or have been a student and you want to continue your studies in Romania:

conversation.aPrompt: Are there any specific requirements for resuming studies after an interruption?
conversation.bResponse:
If you need to resume your studies after an interruption, follow these steps:
1. Go directly to the university where you want to continue your studies.
2. Even without the required documents, you can enroll based on a statement of responsibility about your previous studies. However, each university has its own procedures for evaluating enrollment or resumption of studies.
3. Present the diplomas that granted you access to the study cycle when you complete your studies.
4. For Ukrainian citizens, contact CNRED (the National Center for Diploma Recognition and Equivalence) to help recognize your previously earned diplomas.
5. Remember that the passport doesn't replace a recognized diploma or decision of equivalence. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education
conversation.cSubject: If you are or have been a student and you want to continue your studies in Romania:

conversation.aPrompt: What types of educational programs are available for Ukrainian children in Romania?
conversation.bResponse:
There are several options for Ukrainian children who want to pursue their education in Romania, including:
1. Online kindergartens or part-time kindergartens - These can be useful for working parents who need flexible schedules.
2. Ukrainian schools and classes in different cities of Romania - There are schools with Ukrainian language instruction and curriculum throughout the country.
3. Remote education opportunities - Many schools offer distance learning options so students don't miss out on important lessons.
4. Various learning platforms - Websites such as Khan Academy, Coursera, and edX provide access to courses taught by experts worldwide.
5. Free education in private schools in Romania - Some private institutions may offer tuition-free schooling if families meet certain requirements. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education
conversation.cSubject: Ukrainian schools and kindergartens in Romania

conversation.aPrompt: Are there any free options for Ukrainian students seeking education in Romanian schools?
conversation.bResponse: Yes, there are several options available for Ukrainian students seeking education in Romanian schools, including free options. One option is to look into private schools that offer scholarships or financial aid to international students, such as those provided by local foundations or non-profit organizations. Additionally, some private schools may have tuition-free programs, especially if they receive funding from sponsorships or donations. Another alternative is to explore government-funded educational institutions, which can provide support for low-income families with children who want to pursue an education abroad. Furthermore, it would be beneficial to research the specific city where you plan to study, as each location has its own set of resources and opportunities for Ukrainian students looking for free options. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/education

conversation.aPrompt: What holidays are observed in Romanian schools and kindergartens?
conversation.bResponse: The structure of the Romanian school year includes breaks for national holidays such as Independence Day (1st of December), Christmas Eve (December 24th), New Year's Day (January 1st), Epiphany (January 6th), and Easter Monday (the first day after Easter Sunday). Additionally, there are local holidays specific to each county and city within Romania, which may vary depending on the region. Schools and kindergartens will be closed during these holidays.
